1:
Finally, you're online! I've heard great things about your skills accessing servers. I need your help.
There's a file hiding in the Gibson's depths. It's labelled 'garbage', but to us, it's gold.
I no longer have write access to their system, but you do. I need you to get in, grab the file, and erase it.
I've dropped what you need to access their system in your 'Downloads' folder.
Look in the usual places. Unix systems don't vary much. Find it, take it, erase it.
Finish up and log out. I’ll ping you with the next steps once you're back in the real world.
1_FAIL:
I checked the logs. The file is still sitting pretty. Lost?
Head over to /var/log/. It’s not just logs; it's a goldmine.
Remember, download then delete. It’s a dance. Get the steps right.
Wrap this up. I'm waiting on the other side. Don't dawdle.
1_SUCCESS:
Urgent: Security Breach Confirmation.
Your unauthorized access has been registered in Gibson's systems.
The specific 'garbage' file you tampered with was under our strict surveillance for a reason.
We are aware of your intrusion and the deletion of critical data.
Gibson's top security personnel are now on high alert and tracking your movements.
Cease all activities immediately. Legal consequences are imminent.
Your attempt to remain anonymous is futile. Expect contact for resolution and restitution.
Gibson Security Division.
2:
Damn, you actually did it. And what's this?
Microsoft credentials!? This... this changes everything...
I gave Microsoft my best, and they backstabbed me.
Poured my heart and soul into Window OS, and they bastardized it for greed.
I had these amazing ideas to bring efficiencies and speed, but they said the cost and time to implement was too steep.
They didn't care about the user experience. They just wanted to line their pockets. Hence, Windows Vista was released.
They never learned their lesson. And kept patching and patching till they gave up.
Now you're gonna help me settle the score.
Hack into their server. I want their project files turned to dust. Delete anything ending in '.c'.
Also, change the server password to 'hacked'. Let them know who did this. It's more than revenge; it's justice.
This is our message to the corporate giants. Do this, and we're more than just a team; we're a force.
I’ll be waiting with what’s next once you're out of the matrix.
2_FAIL_DELETE_FILES:
The data's still there. Microsoft's server hasn't felt our wrath yet.
Check everywhere. Their Desktop, Documents. They're sloppy, they leave their files out in the open.
Deleting these files isn't just a task; it's a statement. Don't let me down.
I'll be here, waiting for the good news. Don't make me wait too long.
2_FAIL_CHANGE_PASSWORD:
Did you forget something? The password remains unchanged.
Need a hint? The /etc/ directory holds the key to their 'hidden' secrets.
Changing their password isn't just breaking in; it's taking over. It's making it ours.
I'll reach out to you once you're out. This isn't just a job; it's personal. Finish it.
2_SUCCESS:
Alert: Compromised System Integrity.
We have detected unauthorized access and alterations to our Microsoft server infrastructure.
Your fingerprints are all over the destruction of critical application project files.
The server password has been changed, locking us out of our system. Provide us the new credentials immediately.
This sabotage has not gone unnoticed. Microsoft's legal team is preparing a full-scale response.
You have directly violated several international laws and breached contractual agreements.
Cease your activities. Your anonymity will not protect you.
Microsoft Security Operations.
3:
This is it, the final stretch. Apple's got eyes everywhere, but this time, they saw too much.
We've got a mole on the inside, someone who believes in the cause, someone risking everything for us.
Their security cameras caught our friend in action. We need to scrub that footage clean, leave no trace behind.
But listen, it's crucial we keep the rest intact. We're not here to cause unnecessary chaos; we're here for precision.
Wipe the mole's presence from their archives. Be surgical. Nothing else should be touched.
Do this right, I'll be waiting. Make it count.
3_FAIL:
The mission's not over. Our mole's identity is still compromised, hanging by a thread in Apple's surveillance network.
Precision was key, yet the digital footprint remains. This isn't just about erasing a tape; it's about saving an ally from the spotlight.
Dive back into the shadows. The footage, our comrade's ghost, it still haunts their servers. We need to act, and fast.
I'm counting on you, more than ever. This isn't just another task; it's a lifeline. Erase the evidence, protect our inside voice.
END:
This is it, the end of the line. You've gone above and beyond, diving into the digital abyss and emerging unscathed.
Our journey was more than just about hacking; it was about revealing truths, about fighting back against the faceless giants.
You've proven not just your skills, but your dedication to our cause. The shadows we've cast will linger long in the corridors of power.
But every story has its end, and this is ours. We've changed the game, left our mark, and now, we fade back into the ether.
Remember, though we part ways, the fight isn't over. The system, the establishment, the silent guardians of the status quo... they remain.
Keep your eyes open, stay vigilant, and never forget: in the digital world, we're all just a keystroke away from the next revolution.
Farewell, my friend. Until our paths cross again in the shadows of the net.
3_SUCCESS:
Security Breach Alert: Unauthorized Surveillance Access.
We're contacting you directly regarding the unauthorized deletion of specific security footage from Apple's archives.
The targeted removal of footage concerning our internal personnel has been duly noted.
Your actions have compromised the safety and confidentiality of our operations and employees.
Apple takes these violations seriously. Our cybersecurity team is dissecting the breach, with legal actions to follow.
Discontinuation of your illegal activities is advised. Your attempts at anonymity will be unmasked.
Direct engagement from our legal department is forthcoming. Prepare for repercussions.
Apple Corporate Security.
